All Classes

  • All Classes Class Summary Enum Summary 
    Class Description
    AIAgentComponent
    AI movement component given to customer entities.
    AnimationComponent
    Component give to anything that wants to be animated.
    B2dBodyComponent
    Component for things that interact with physics.
    BoostData  
    Box2dLocation
    Vector2 wrapper that contains body orientation.
    Box2dRadiusProximity
    A Box2dRadiusProximity is a Proximity that queries the world for all fixtures that potentially overlap the circle having the specified detection radius and whose center is the owner position.
    Box2dSquareAABBProximity
    A Box2dSquareAABBProximity is a Proximity that queries the world for all fixtures that potentially overlap the square AABB built around the circle having the specified detection radius and whose center is the owner position.
    Box2dSquareAABBProximity.AABB  
    Box2dSteeringBody
    Box2D Body and logic for AI agents, the Box2dSteeringBody responds to inputs from a SteeringBehavior.
    CarryItemsSystem
    This is just a system that runs every frame to update the position of carried items to follow their carrier.
    CollisionCategory
    Collision categories allow specifying which Box2D fixtures collide with each other.
    ControllableComponent
    Component given to any entity that may at some point be controlled by the player.
    CookAnimator
    Animations specific to the cooks.
    cookBoostComponent
    Given to players while they are under the effect of a cook boost powerup.
    CookData  
    CookingComponent
    Component for a food/ingredient that can be cooked/processed.
    CustomerAISystem
    Controls the AI Customers, creates orders.
    CustomerAnimator
    Animations specific to the customers.
    CustomerComponent
    Inventory-storing component for customers.
    CustomerData  
    cutBoostComponent
    Given to players while they are under the effect of a cut boost powerup.
    DebugRendererSystem
    This class is unused by the main codebase.
    EntityFactory
    Factory pattern class that creates entities used in the game.
    FoodComponent
    An entity is "food" if it has FoodComponent, ie it has the attribute `type` (which is a FoodType).
    FoodComponent.FoodType
    These are the hard values behind the food types used in recipes etc.
    FoodData  
    FoodStack  
    GameScreen  
    GdxTimer
    Simple timer class suitable for this project.
    Hud
    HUD user interface rendering for the game, also includes the win screen.
    InventoryUpdateSystem
    Links up the cook's inventory to the hud.
    InWorldStoreSystem  
    ItemComponent
    This is just given to entities that can be carried, placed on workstations etc.
    KeyboardInput  
    LightBuilder
    Helper class that stores light definitions.
    LightingSystem
    Most lighting stuff is done for us but we need to give it information, that's what we do here.
    LockedComponent  
    MainMenuScreen
    Main menu of the game, transitions the player to the Tutorial Slideshow on button press
    MapBodyBuilder
    Populates the world with bodies created from the obstacle layer.
    MapLoader
    Loads and owns the TiledMap object.
    Mappers
    Static class, holds all the ComponentMapper instances we need, as there is no reason to have multiple instaces of a ComponentMapper.
    orderBoostComponent
    Given to players when they collect an order boost powerup.
    OvercookingComponent
    Component for a food/ingredient that can be cooked/processed.
    Pair<K,​V>
    Create a generic tuple.
    PhysicsSystem
    Steps the Box2D world and maps the body positions to their TransformComponents to link physics and rendering.
    PiazzaPanic
    This class wraps the spritebatch.
    PlayerComponent
    A chef has this if it is being controlled right now.
    PlayerControlSystem
    Controls whichever one cook has the PlayerComponent
    PowerupComponent
    Component given to entities that are powerups, which get dotted around the kitchen.
    PowerupComponent.powerupType  
    PowerupPickupSystem
    A system that runs constantly, proactively checking if powerups have been collided with, marked for deletion etc.
    PowerupSpawnControllerComponent
    This component is given to a single entity in GameScreen.java which then gets put straight into `engine`.
    PowerupSpawnerComponent
    Given to entities that spawn powerups.
    PowerupSpawnSystem
    Runs every frame, determines "random intervals" by just rolling to see if something should spawn every frame, using a very low probability.
    RenderingSystem
    Has a bunch of "convenience" methods that do a lot of leg work for progressing animations, drawing in the right place on screen etc.
    SaveData  
    SaveHandler
    We need to save: - Money - Reputation - Stations unlocked.
    Slideshow
    A screen that displays a slideshow of images.
    Slideshow.Type
    Slideshow type enumeration.
    speedBoostComponent
    Given to players while they are under the effect of a speed boost powerup.
    Station
    Helper class for storing station recipes and Station.StationType of the current station.
    Station.itemDisplayDir
    Named enumeration of the item display directions.
    Station.StationType
    Named enumeration of the station types.
    StationComponent
    Component given to all stations placed around the level.
    StationData  
    StationSystem
    This system manages player-station interaction and station food processing.
    StoreScreen
    Implementation of core store functioanlity as per FR_INVESTMENT
    TestHud
    HUD user interface rendering for the game, also includes the win screen.
    TextureComponent
    All entities will have this because it's assumed all entities want to be rendered.
    timeFreezeBoostComponent
    Given to players while the rest of time stops ticking around them.
    TintComponent
    This gives a tint to an entity, this is only used on food that has been processed on a station.
    TransformComponent
    Component for things that have, in their own right, a position, scale, and rotation.
    WalkAnimator
    Abstract class that helps with setting up animations for characters in the game.
    WalkAnimator.Direction
    All directions that the animations support.
    WalkingAnimationComponent
    Component for things that walk (i.e.
    WorldContactListener
    Handles collision events, allows interactivity between the player and other objects.
    WorldTilemapRenderer
    Renders a TiledMap that is loaded using MapLoader.
    YComparator
    Compares entities by their Y coordinate, so entities that are lower on the screen appear in front for a consistent perspective.
    ZComparator
    Compares the entities by their Z coordinate.
